column4: somehow whenever I open a terminal program, it defaults to ~/scripts/compiz, not ~. Both gnome-terminal and terminator do the same thing. what would cause this?
at the bottom of ~/.bashrc    add:   cd ~/
mint has a tiny community compared to Ubuntu's
if you compare mint to ubuntu yes , ubuntu dwarfs the linux mint community
could install LXDE or XFCE and use your Gnome apps there and get the great support from the Ubuntu community :)
I tried lubuntu, xubuntu, neither of those were right for me. linux mint's repositories can blend with ubuntu's without too much trouble
